title: Best festive quiz as Daily Star aims to settle  who is the brightest in your family
body_text:
Best festive quiz as Daily Star aims to settle 'who is the brightest in your family'
Settle down with your pens and paper to enjoy our Daily Star super festive quiz and finally find out who the brightest and best is this Christmas
Forget that pesky hangover, the boring clearing up or wondering what to do with the leftovers – it’s time to kick back and box clever with our traditional family quiz.
Get set to fire up your little grey cells with James Moore's brilliant brainteasers covering everything from TV and movies to sport and music, not forgetting some special puzzlers for the kids.
Simply tick off which answers from the multiple-choice posers you think are right.
Tot up all your correct answers and then check whether you’re a cracker or a crackpot and remember to keep score (and don't cheat, Uncle Barry).
READ MORE: Bloke counts how many Celebrations in tub – and one chocolate crops up more
You can read more lifestyle stories from Daily Star here.
TV Quiz...
1) Ncuti Gatwa has made his debut as the new Doctor Who. But in what year did the time-travelling character first hit television?
A) 1963
B) 1973
C) 1983
2) In which fictional place is Coronation Street set?
A) Walford
B) Walmington-On-Sea
C) Weatherfield
3) What’s the name of the TV show that Ralf Little will return in tonight as DI Neville Parker…
A) Murder In Paradise
B) Death In Paradise
C) Pain In Paradise
4) Next year is 20 years since Strictly Come Dancing hit screens. Who was the first celebrity winner?
A) Tony Blackburn
B) Jack Dee
C) Natasha Kaplinsky
5) On which TV sitcom would you have found the late Matthew Perry?
A) Frasier
B) Friends
C) Fawlty Towers
Movie quiz...
6) Margot Robbie played Barbie on the big screen recently, but who played Ken in the movie?
A) Ryan Reynolds
B) Ryan Gosling
C) Ryan Giggs
7) In 1988’s Die Hard, starring Bruce Willis, what is the name of the villain played by Alan Rickman?
A) Ernst Blofeld
B) Hans Gruber
C) Norman Bates
8) What age is movie star Michael Caine, star of The Italian Job, Alfie and Zulu?
A) 70
B) 80
C) 90
9) Raquel Welch died this year aged 82. For which of these films is she famous?
A) One Million Years BC
B) Barbarella
C) Planet Of The Apes
10) Complete the name of the movie: Indiana Jones And The Dial Of ____?
A) Doom
B) Disaster
C) Destiny
Music quiz...
11) What were the NYPD choir singing about in Shane MacGowan and Kirsty MacColl festive hit Fairytale Of New York?
A) Whitley Bay
B) Galway Bay
C) Botany Bay
12) What was the name of the song which won Eurovision for Sweden’s Loreen this year?
A) Flowers
B) Tattoo
C) Vampire
13) Twelve of what are featured in the classic festive song Twelve Days Of Christmas?
A) Drummers
B) Pipers
C) Trumpeters
14) What was the name of singer Taylor Swift’s famous tour in 2023?
A) Aeons
B) Ages
C) Eras
15) The Rolling Stones released their first new album since 2005 this year. What was its name?
A) Hackney Pearls
B) Hackney Diamonds
C) Hackney Rubies
Sport quiz...
16) The Lionesses narrowly lost the Women’s FIFA World Cup Final to Spain 1-0. What was the name of England’s goalkeeper who saved a penalty?
A) Lucy Bronze
B) Mary Earps
C) Ella Toone
17) With which sport would you associate I’m A Celeb’s Frankie Dettori?
A) Golf
B) Motor racing
C) Horse racing
18) Manchester City won the Premier League, FA Cup and Champions League this year. Which mode of transport is featured on its badge?
A) A train
B) A plane
C) A ship
19) What is the highest possible score with three arrows in darts?
A) 147
B) 180
C) 360
20) In which country will the Euro 2024 championships be held?
A) Germany
B) Turkey
C) Italy
Lucky dip quiz...
21) How many squares or spacesare there on a traditional Monopoly board?
A) 20
B) 30
C) 40
22) Which of these drink brands has a bat as its logo?
A) Guinness
B) Bacardi
C) Smirnoff
23) With which box of chocolates would you associate the Purple One, the Green Triangle and the Toffee Penny?
A) Quality Street
B) Celebrations
C) Cadbury’s Roses
24) How many of Henry VIII’s wives were called Catherine?
A) One
B) Two
C) Three
25) Which of these foods brands is known for its 57 varieties?
A) Heinz
B) McVitie’s
C) Walkers
Kids quiz...
26) In the Harry Potter stories, which of these characters’ middle name is Bilius?
A) Harry Potter
B) Ron Weasley
C) Hermione Granger
27) How many minutes are there in one-and-a-half hours, the same as a typical football match?
A) 60
B) 90
C) 120
28) Which author created the character of Willy Wonka?
A) Roald Dahl
B) David Walliams
C) Enid Blyton
29) Which “red planet” also shares its name with a chocolate bar?
A) Venus
B) Mars
C) Saturn
30) What is a baby goat called?
A) Calf
B) Puppy
C) Kid
And now the answers...
ANSWERS: 1)A 2)C 3)B 4)C 5)B 6)B 7)B 8)C 9)A 1 0)C 11)B 12)B 13)A 14)C 15)B 16)B 17)C 18)C 19)B 20)A 21)C 22)B 23)A 24)C 25)A 26)B 27)B 28)A 29)B 30)C
Your score means...
21-30 ALL WRAPPED UP! A banger of a Boxing Day result. Award yourself (another) treat.
11-20 ELF & SAFELY: You might not be top of the tree, but you’ve shown baubles. Well done.
0-10 TOTAL TURKEY! What a load of giblets! You got a bit of a stuffing…better luck next time.
